intro: Valerianella hispidiuscula, commonly known as hairy valerian, is a small annual herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and features hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Valerianella hispidiuscula is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and fields.
